Author: Rodrigo Zechin Rosauro 
http://droidwall.googlecode.com 
 
Droid Wall - Android Firewall is a front-end application for the powerful iptables Linux firewall. It allows you to restrict which applications are permitted to access your data networks. 
This is the perfect solution if you don't have an unlimited data plan, or just wants to see your battery lasting longer. 
Using Droid Wall: 
1. Click on Mode to switch between White List and Black List modes. 
2. Mark the applications that you want to block or allow (depending on the selected mode), for each interface. 
3. Open the menu and click on Enable Firewall. 
Note: After enabling the firewall, the rules will be saved and automatically restored every-time you restart your phone. 
 
Other features: 
Click on Show rules menu to display current iptables rules output. 
 
Click on Save rules to save your currently selected applications without enabling the firewall. 
 
When the firewall is enabled, click on Apply rules to save your currently selected applications and immediately apply the rules. 
 
Password lock: 
You can set a password lock for Droid Wall by using the Set password menu option. To remove the password protection, just reset it to blank.
